publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-2343 Robin Harper: The Royal Incorporation of Architects in Scotland: Sustainable Design Accreditation—That the Parliament welcomes the launch of the RIAS Sustainable Design Accreditation Scheme on 1 February 2005 at Holyrood; notes that this is believed to be the first such scheme in the world and as such offers an opportunity for Scotland to take a global lead in sustainable building design and so reap the rewards for communities, for the environment and for Scottish entrepreneurship; further notes the pivotal role of building design in tackling fuel poverty and reducing overall energy use, thus reducing climate change emissions, and supports setting targets for improving the existing, and future, housing stock in Scotland that are both realistic and ambitious. Supported by: Donald Gorrie*
